title: The 25 Best Travel Pants That Aren’t Leggings
description: Heading off on a trip and don’t know what to wear? Whether you’re venturing to the airport, the train station, or in the car, one thing’s for sure: Comfort is non-negotiable. Sure, trusty leggings and cozy sweats are MVPs, but sometimes, you want to look a little more “effortless jet-setter” and a little less “just rolled out of bed.” Enter: travel pants. When curating our list of the best travel pants, we held them to sky-high standards: They needed to be versatile enough to wear straight off the plane and into whatever adventure awaits, comfy enough for the bizarre yoga-esque positions you’ll find yourself in while attempting to sleep on a long-haul flight, and stylish enough to pair seamlessly with the rest of your wardrobe (and avoid the dreaded overpacking guilt). Bonus points to pants with practical perks like wrinkle-resistance, technical fabrics, and — the holy grail — pockets.Meet our 25 favorite travel pants below. Once you experience the magic of sweat-wicking, breezy, and polished bottoms that don’t scream “athleisure overload,” we promise you’ll never look back.All linked products are independently selected by our editors. If you purchase any of these products, we may earn a commission.Quince 100% Organic Cotton Gauze Straight Leg PantsWith a relaxed fit and an adjustable waist, these gauzy pants are equal parts comfort and cool for travel days and beyond.Quince 100% Organic Cotton Gauze Straight Leg Pants, $, available at QuinceAritzia HomeStretch Rib PantThese stretchy ribbed pants are built for movement, whether you’re racing to your gate or exploring a new city. Made from a heavyweight version of Aritzia’s cult-loved HomeStretch fabric, they hug in all the right places with a soft, cottony feel.Aritzia HomeStretch Rib Pant, $, available at AritziaViens Avec Moi Crinkle Cotton Gauze Wide Leg Pants Not into linen? Go for gauzy cotton instead — breezy, lightweight, and perfect for jetting to a warm-weather destination.Viens Avec Moi Crinkle Cotton Gauze Wide Leg Pants, $, available at NordstromOld Navy Extra High-Waisted Stevie Straight Ankle PantsIf a kick-flare pant isn’t in your travel lineup yet, prepare to wonder how you survived without one.Old Navy Extra High-Waisted Stevie Straight Ankle Pants, $, available at Old NavyGap Stripe-Print Straight PantsA jeans look with airy, pajama comfort. Gap Cotton Gauze Denim Easy Barrel Pants, $, available at GapSPANX AirEssentials Brushed Straight Leg PantComfort meets polish: These straight-leg pants have a silky-soft feel, four-way stretch, and pintuck details for a more refined travel look — perfect for long-haul flights, road trips, and beyond. SPANX AirEssentials Brushed Straight Leg Pant, $, available at SPANXWe The Free Park Ave PantsLaidback and utility-driven, these cargo pants are built for travel days. An elastic waist keeps things comfortable, while roomy pockets stash essentials within reach.We The Free Park Ave Pants, $, available at Free PeopleJ.Crew Cosmo PantA cotton-poplin pant to go with your favorite coordinating shirt? Yes, and yes. J.Crew Cosmo Pant in Oxford Stripe, $, available at J.CrewCaslon Wide Leg Crop Cotton Gauze PantsPajama-level swish meets go-anywhere polish. These linen-blend wide-legs are as easy as they are elevated.Caslon Wide Leg Crop Cotton Gauze Pants, $, available at NordstromLululemon Dance Studio Mid-Rise JoggerPockets make the difference between good travel pants and great ones. This mid-rise cargo style from Lululemon ticks all the right boxes, blending travel-day function with comfy style.Lululemon Dance Studio Mid-Rise Jogger Full Length, $, available at LululemonDaily Practice by Anthropologie Messa JumpsuitThe iconic swish of ’90s-inspired parachute pants is like an audible time machine, triggering nostalgic vibes we’re fully into for travel days. Daily Practice by Anthropologie Messa Jumpsuit, $, available at AnthropologieTreasure & Bond Drawstring Wide Leg Pants Crisper than sweats, comfier than jeans — these wide-leg pants with a drawstring waist are polished enough to go straight from plane to plans.Treasure and Bond Drawstring Wide Leg Pants, $, available at NordstromAdidas Originals 3 Stripes Wide Leg Pants Travel-day icon status, unlocked — thanks to this teal three-stripe pair from Adidas.Adidas 3 Stripes Wide Leg Pants, $, available at NordstromUniversal Thread Pull-On Cargo PantsLight, minimal, and made for breezing through travel (even when the journey gets stressful). Size up for maximum in-transit comfort. Everlane The Utility Curve Pant, $, available at EverlanePetal & Pup Hana Print Tie Waist Wide Leg Pants These pants literally scream travel — the perfect pair for making a statement in transit and beyond.Petal and Pup Hana Print Tie Waist Wide Leg Pants, $, available at NordstromMadewell Pull-On Barrel PantsA bright, linen barrel leg for summer travel? Heading off on a trip and don’t know what to wear? Whether you’re venturing to the airport, the train station, or in the car, one thing’s for sure: Comfort is non-negotiable. Sure, trusty leggings and cozy sweats are MVPs, but sometimes, you want to look a little more “effortless jet-setter” and a little less “just rolled out of bed.” Enter: travel pants. 

When curating our list of the best travel pants, we held them to sky-high standards: They needed to be versatile enough to wear straight off the plane and into whatever adventure awaits, comfy enough for the bizarre yoga-esque positions you’ll find yourself in while attempting to sleep on a long-haul flight, and stylish enough to pair seamlessly with the rest of your wardrobe (and avoid the dreaded overpacking guilt). Bonus points to pants with practical perks like wrinkle-resistance, technical fabrics, and — the holy grail — pockets.

Meet our 25 favorite travel pants below. Once you experience the magic of sweat-wicking, breezy, and polished bottoms that don’t scream “athleisure overload,” we promise you’ll never look back.
